meanings.definition: Excessive concern with one's own appearance or manners.
meanings.sent1: Her prissiness about her outfit made her late for the party.
meanings.sent2: Her prissiness often led to her spending hours in front of the mirror.
meanings.sent3: Despite her prissiness, she still managed to have a good time at the event.
meanings.sent4: Her prissiness was like a shield, protecting her from any criticism.
meanings.sent5: The level of her prissiness was unmatched, drawing attention wherever she went.

meanings.definition: Behavior or attitude characterized by excessive refinement or propriety.
meanings.sent1: His prissiness in table manners was evident during the formal dinner.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's prissiness in classroom decorum set a high standard for the students.
meanings.sent3: The cat's prissiness in grooming itself amused the whole family.
meanings.sent4: Her prissiness in organizing events was like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The prissiness of the royal family was admired by all who visited the palace.
